WorkPlace.Description: SKELMOSE ApS er en virksomhed der arbejder med rekruttering og virksomhedsudvikling. Vi rekrutterer primært ledere og specialister.

HiringOrg.Description: SKELMOSE ApS er en virksomhed der arbejder med rekruttering og virksomhedsudvikling. Vi rekrutterer primært ledere og specialister.
HiringOrg.OrganizationDescription: SKELMOSE ApS er en virksomhed der arbejder med rekruttering og virksomhedsudvikling. Vi rekrutterer primært ledere og specialister.

JobPositionInformation.Purpose:
At K2 Management we are busy working on a large number of on- and offshore renewable projects and the electrical infrastructure is key for these projects and will only become even more important in the future. 

Are you an experienced people manager with deep knowledge of the electrical infrastructure related to renewable energy projects? And are you ready to utilize your leadership experience and technical expertise among a global team of specialists and ambitious clients in a leading consultancy within the renewable industry? Then you may be candidate for this exciting job opportunity. 

K2 Management is looking for an experienced manager to head the global Electrical Engineering Centre of Excellence. A manager who can actively provide both technical and team leadership. You will be a key driver in setting the agenda for this service area and build your team around a mutually agreed strategy. Based in Denmark – either in Aarhus or Copenhagen, you will be reporting to the Director, Project Operation (Co-Founder). 

Lead a team of specialists and ensure top-notch electrical engineering capabilities 

As Head of Electrical Infrastructure your primary responsibility will be to develop, train and coach a team of highly skilled electrical engineers globally and to ensure that your team provides accurate work, on time and budget to clients and projects.

Furthermore, you will:  

  • Develop a strategic plan to manage the growth of Electrical Engineering (in cooperation with Director, Project Operation) and manage continuous improvement of technical capabilities on a global scale 
  • Ensure work to the Electrical Engineering team
  • Support the tender and sales process of the electrical team services
  • Sign off for all electrical engineering work in K2 Management globally 
  • Manage a continuous improvement process for Electrical Engineering and ensure technical capabilities within K2 Management on a global scale in line with the strategy plan 
  • Provide technical advice and support to clients 
  • Resource- and competence management within a growing team and expanding workload, with numerous active projects  
  • Cooperate, communicate, and coordinate with other engineering and non-engineering managers
  • Enable knowledge management and continuous learning within the engineering team  

Experienced electrical engineer with proven leadership skills 

You have an engineering background combined with 5+ years of experience from the renewable industry (wind and/or solar), and you are driven by creating great results through a high-performing team. In addition, you have:  

  • Proven and demonstrable leadership capabilities 
  • 10+ years of experience with power systems transmission and infrastructure projects 
  • Knowledge and experience within several of the following areas: power plant, transmission and distribution asset, grid connection, earthing, protection, HV/MV switchgear, power-electronics, submarine cable and HVDC systems and power systems design 
  • Experience within hybrid power systems and battery storage systems 
  • Excellent communication skills in English, both verbally and in writing and the ability to explain technical issues to non-engineers, including clients

As a person, you are pro-active, robust and client oriented, always aiming at delivering high quality, optimum support and stretched flexibility. You have a structured and persistent approach to your assignments, while at the same time maintaining a great overview. Furthermore, you have an open-minded and cooperative personality, and you provide visionary and attentive leadership, always keeping in mind what is best for the company. Your diplomatic skills and honesty are requirements in a multi-cultural organization as well as the ability to work cross functional.   

About K2 Management 

At K2 Management, we support our clients in their efforts to develop and operate wind and solar projects that achieve the best possible return on investment. We are a global team of highly experienced specialists with practical knowledge from wind and solar projects all over the world. We are dedicated to supporting our clients’ efforts to achieve their wind and solar project milestones, within targeted cost, schedule, and quality parameters, so the resulting wind and solar farms operate as expected. K2 Management has offices worldwide and employs approx. 170 people today. 

You will be working with great colleagues in a global organization with the opportunity to be close to our core business, which is developing and supporting onshore and offshore projects all over the world on behalf of our clients. We work as one team with dedication, respect and credibility as our core values. Overall, you will have a unique and challenging job where you have every opportunity to learn and develop your skills as a team member of a highly professional environment with a strong technical and commercial commitment.

We encourage everyone to apply regardless of gender, nationality, race, religion or any other characteristics protected by law. For further information, please visit www.k2management.com

Further information / application

If you wish to know more about this vacancy before applying, you are welcome to contact Anders Hasager, Skelmose, on mobile 30 23 70 12.

Please apply here.

We look forward to receiving your application.

Applications will be processed on an ongoing basis.
